summary: Body signals (sleep, energy, stress, appetite, hydration) influence each other. Addressing the earliest upstream driver often breaks the loop more effectively than treating the most visible symptom.
observed_patterns: Stress high → sleep low → next-day energy low
Late meal → sleep quality down → next-day energy flat
Low hydration + busy day → afternoon fatigue
implication_logic: If multiple signals are off, identify the driver that feeds the others (e.g. evening stress before sleep, meal timing before sleep quality).
intervention_leverage: Intervene at the earliest leverage point in the loop (e.g. reduce stress before bed rather than only extending sleep).

summary: User notes reflect intent and context, not medical history. Interpret cause vs outcome; respond to cause. Do not quote typos or raw note text.
implication_logic: If a note mentions stress and poor sleep, treat stress as potential driver of sleep rather than describing the note back.
intervention_leverage: Respond with mechanism-based interpretation and one contextual adjustment; use pattern-specific closing.
